result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: (CB) electrons from TiO 2 to Au cocatalysts under ultraviolet light irradiation and promoting the hot electron injection from plasmonic Au into the CB of TiO 2 with the excitation of Au by visible light.The more efficient interfacial charge transfer and separation enable more electrons participating in the conversion of CO 2 to CO and CH 4 .As a result, at both excitation wavelengths, the Au-TiO 2 sample with exclusive AuTiO 2 (1 0 1) interfaces significantly ameliorates the photocatalytic activities in CO

a cocatalyst in preventing the charge recombination.Au-TiO 2 (O), Au-TiO 2 (T) and Au-TiO 2 (S) achieve 2.6, 1.6 and 4.1-folds increases in the photocurrent density, respectively, implying the different contributions of Au to the charge transfer and separation.Resultantly, the photocurrent densities turn out to be in the sequence of Au-TiO 2 (O) Au-TiO 2 (T) Au-TiO 2 (S).The photoluminescence (PL) spectra are in well agreement with the photocurrent results.As shown in Fig. 4c, the introduction of Au leads

size, morphology, crystalline structure and chemical states of Au-TiO 2 (O) could be well-maintained after the cyclic process, highlighting the good recyclability of the photocatalyst (Figs.S8-S10).No low-carbon product was detected in the control experiments including without catalysts, in the dark and in the Ar atmosphere instead of CO 2 , confirming that the reduction products actually originate from the photoreduction of CO 2 rather than adsorbed carbon species.The carbon sources of the produced CO and

photocatalytic activities in CO and CH 4 production compared to other samples containing AuTiO 2 (0 0 1) interfaces.The interfacial facet engineered Schottky barrier may open a new window to rationally designing metal-semiconductor hybrid structures for photocatalysis.

sources of the produced CO and CH 4 were also confirmed by the 13 C isotope labeling experiment over Au-TiO 2 (O), in which the signals at mz 29 and mz 17 in the gas chromatographymass spectrometry can be assigned to 13 CO and 13 CH 4 , respectively (Fig. 3c,d). The different orders of the Au-TiO 2 samples in photocatalytic activity and CO 2 adsorption imply that the surface reactivity is not the only factor determining the CO 2 conversion efficiency.The light absorption abilities of the TiO 2 based

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: measurements were performed on a CHI 760E electrochemical station (Shanghai Chenhua, China) in ambient conditions under irradiation of a 300 W Xe lamp (PLS-SXE 300D300DUV, Beijing Perfectlight, China).UV and visible lights were used as the illumination source, which were realized in the presence of a shortwave-pass 420 nm cutoff filter (320 420 nm) and a long-wavepass 420 nm cutoff filter (420 780 nm), and the power densities were measured to be 33 and 100 mW cm -2 , respectively.A threeelectrode cell was

were carried out in a 100 mL reactor purchased from Beijing Perfectlight Company (China) under atmospheric pressure at ambient temperature (298 K), in which 10 mg of the photocatalysts were dispersed in 1 mL H 2 O at the bottom.Prior to the test, the reactor loaded with the catalyst was first purged with high purity CO 2 for 20 min.Then the light-irradiation experiment was performed by using a 300-W Xe lamp (PLS-SXE 300D300DUV, Beijing Perfectlight, China) with UV and visible light as the illumination

light as the illumination source, respectively.The UV and visible light was realized in the presence of a short-wave-pass 420 nm cutoff filter (320 420 nm) and a longwave-pass 420 nm cutoff filter (420 780 nm), and the power densities of which were measured to be 33 and 100 mW cm -2 , respectively.After the photocatalytic reaction for 4 h, the products were analyzed using a gas chromatograph (GC-2014, Shimadzu) with Ar as the carrier gas.The amount of CH 4 was measured by using a flame ionization detector

under both visible and UV light irradiation.Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) was performed in the 10 -1 to 10 5 Hz frequency range with an AC voltage amplitude of mV at an applied potential of 0.1 V versus AgAgCl under UV light irradiation.Transient open-circuit voltage decay (OCVD) was measured for a total of 800 s under visible light irradiation, and the light was switched on and off after 100 and 400 s from the start, respectively. The photocatalytic experiments were carried out in a 100 mL

threeelectrode cell was used to perform the electrochemical measurements with the ITO-coated glass, AgAgCl electrode and Pt foil used as the working electrode, reference electrode and counter electrode, respectively.The three electrodes were inserted in a quartz cell filled with 0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 electrolyte.The photocurrent density was measured under chopped light irradiation (light onoff cycles: 30 s) at a bias potential of 0.4 V versus AgAgCl for 600 s under both visible and UV light

a flame ionization detector (FID).CO was converted to CH 4 using a methanation reactor and then analyzed using the FID.The O 2 was also detected using a thermal conductivity detector (TCD).During the stability test, the photocatalyst with the best catalytic activity was collected after each run and then reused for the reduction of CO 2 .Isotope-labeling experiments were performed using 13 CO 2 , and the products were analyzed using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (7890B5977A, Agilent).
